p: The experimental results showed that the six compounds had fumigation toxic effects on the adults and eggs of P. operculella. Among them, δ-3-carene, γ-terpinene, and terpinolene had weaker fumigation effects than those of eucarvone, 3,5-dimethoxytoluene, and methyleugenol. The LC 50 was >4.1 for P. operculella adults treated with δ-3-carene, γ-terpinene, and terpinolene and the LC 50 was <1.8 for P. operculella adults treated with eucarvone, 3,5-dimethoxytoluene, and methyleugenol. The LC 50 was >2.6 for P. operculella eggs treated with δ-3-carene, γ-terpinene, and terpinolene and the LC 50 was <1.1 for the P. operculella eggs treated with eucarvone, 3,5-dimethoxytoluene, and methyleugenol. Among eucarvone, 3,5-dimethoxytoluene, and methyleugenol, eucarvone had the strongest fumigation effect on the adults and methyleugenol had the strongest fumigation effect on the eggs.
